questions.question: What is a callback?
questions.details: In javascript, functions are treated as first-class citizens, they can be used as an argument of another function, can be returned by another function and can be used as a property of an object.
questions.shortAns: It is a function that will be executed after another function gets executed.

questions.question: What is a Promise?
questions.details: In javascript, Promises are objects that can be in 1 of 3 states - pending, fullfilled or rejected. The condition or state can then be used to control a callback function
questions.shortAns: It is an object that can be in 1 of 3 states depending on the condition of the code

questions.question: What is a dog?
questions.details: The dog is characterized by an upturning tail. The dog derived from an ancient, extinct wolf, and the modern grey wolf is the dog's nearest living relative.
questions.shortAns: It is a domesticated descendant of the wolf.

questions.question: Is a train characterized by a rail transport?
questions.details: It is a form of transport consisting of a series of connected vehicles that generally run along a railroad track to transport passengers or cargo. The word train comes from the Old French trahiner, derived from the Latin trahere meaning

questions.question: What are the advantages of JavaScript over other web technologies?
questions.details: JavaScript is a scripting language. It is different from Java language. It is object-based, lightweight, cross-platform translated language. It is widely used for client-side validation.
questions.shortAns: Enhanced Interaction,Quick Feedback,Rich User Interface,Less server interaction.

questions.question: What is a callback?
questions.details: Case sensitivity is a feature that helps to ensure that the same code will run on different computers. When a programmer uses case sensitivity, they must use different case for different identifiers to make sure that the code will run on different computers.
questions.shortAns: Yes, JavaScript is a case sensitive language.

questions.question: Can you assign an anonymous function to a variable and pass it as an argument to another function?
questions.details: In javascript, It is a function that has no name. These functions are declared dynamically at runtime using the function operator instead of the function declaration.
questions.shortAns: Yes! An anonymous function can be assigned to a variable. It can also be passed as an argument to another function.

questions.question: What is BOM?
questions.details: The window object provides various properties like document, history, screen, navigator, location, innerHeight, innerWidth. You can call all the functions of the window by specifying the window or directly.
questions.shortAns: BOM stands for Browser Object Model. It provides interaction with the browser. The default object of a browser is a window.
